page.title: 17Scott Memorial,Cortachy
page.content: Standing by the roadside in{Glen {Prosen,}is the{Scott Memorial {Cairn,}which was erected in 1981 on the site of the original memorial-a fountain-which was accidentally destroyed by a car in 1979.The money was provided by the local Community Assocn. and Angus District Council. It marks the spot where{Captain Scott and{Dr.Edward Wilson}used to stand and admire the beautiful view.At the foot of the glen is{Burnside Bungalow} where Scott stayed with Wilson while they planned their expedition to the {South Pole,}from which they never returned. An inscription reads-"Given into the care of the people of{Cortachy }for them to hold in remembrance. {Robert Falcon Scott}and{Edward Wilson} who knew this Glen.They reached the {South Pole}on{17th January,1912}----"
